episodeTitle: Rescuing Our Friend! Raid on the Franky House!
description: After Usopp is brutally beaten by the Franky Family and their money stolen, Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Chopper track him to Franky House. Finding Usopp unconscious, they storm the hideout to avenge their friend, only to discover Franky has already left with the money.

events.title: Usopp Confronts the Franky Family Alone
events.description: Usopp arrives at Franky House and demands the return of the 200 million berries stolen from him. Despite being outnumbered, he bravely stands his ground and attempts to fight the Franky Family to recover the crew's money.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's determination to prove his worth to the crew despite his insecurities. This moment sets up his later conflict about feeling useless to the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Give me back that money! It belongs to my crew!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp demanding the stolen money from the Franky Family

events.title: Franky Defeats Usopp
events.description: Franky easily dodges Usopp's attacks and mocks him while he's down. After delivering a final devastating kick to Usopp's chin, Franky leaves to go shopping with the stolen money, leaving Usopp to be beaten further by the other Franky Family members.
events.significance: This brutal beating becomes the catalyst for the Straw Hats' raid on Franky House and contributes to Usopp's feelings of inadequacy that lead to his confrontation with Luffy about the Going Merry.

quotes.text: I'm going out shopping with the Straw Hats' money!
quotes.speaker: Franky

events.title: Usopp Brutally Beaten by Franky Family
events.description: After Franky leaves, members of the Franky Family continue to mercilessly beat the already defeated Usopp, leaving him bloody and unconscious outside their hideout. Usopp even shoots an exploding star at Franky that has no effect.
events.significance: One of the darkest moments in the series, showing a Straw Hat crew member completely defeated and humiliated. This beating becomes a turning point in the Water 7 arc, fueling the crew's anger and contributing to Usopp's emotional breakdown.

events.title: Crew Discovers Usopp's Blood Trail
events.description: Chopper notices a trail of blood leading away from where they split up. The crew follows it, realizing that Usopp must have gone to confront the Franky Family on his own. Their worry grows as they track the blood through Water 7's streets.
events.significance: This moment showcases the crew's bond and their concern for Usopp. It also builds tension as they realize what danger their friend has put himself in.

quotes.text: This is Usopp's blood! He must have gone to the Franky House alone!
quotes.speaker: Chopper

events.title: The Crew Finds Usopp Unconscious
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Chopper arrive at Franky House to find Usopp passed out in front of the building, severely beaten and bloody. The sight of their friend in this condition fills them with rage and determination for revenge.
events.significance: This emotional moment cements the crew's bond and their willingness to fight for each other. It's a powerful display of their friendship and loyalty, driving them to storm Franky House regardless of the consequences.

events.title: Straw Hats Declare War on Franky Family
events.description: Seeing Usopp's condition, Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Chopper storm into Franky House and challenge the entire Franky Family. They discover that Franky himself has already left with the money, but decide to fight anyway to avenge what was done to Usopp.
events.significance: The crew makes it clear that their friend's well-being matters more than the money. This moment emphasizes the Straw Hats' core values of loyalty and protecting their nakama above all else.

quotes.text: The money doesn't matter anymore. It's what you did to Usopp!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explaining why they're fighting the Franky Family

events.title: Introduction to Franky Family Members
events.description: The crew walks in on the Franky Family members celebrating and partying, high on the money they stole. Various members including Zambai and the Square Sisters are shown reveling in their hideout.
events.significance: First proper introduction to the Franky Family organization and its colorful cast of members who will become important allies later in the series.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Cannon Debut
events.description: Luffy unveils his Gomu Gomu no Cannon technique during the fight, showcasing a powerful attack where he inflates his body and releases a devastating blast of air toward his opponents.
events.significance: Introduction of a new technique in Luffy's arsenal, demonstrating his continued growth as a fighter and the evolution of his Devil Fruit abilities.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy using his new technique for the first time

events.title: Karasuma Gari Debut
events.description: Zoro demonstrates his new Santoryu technique, Karasuma Gari (Crow Demon Hunt), slicing through iron cannonballs with ease during the battle at Franky House.
events.significance: Showcases Zoro's growth as a swordsman and his ability to cut through increasingly difficult materials, foreshadowing his future development.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro using his new technique to cut iron cannonballs

events.title: Party Table Kick Course Debut
events.description: Sanji unleashes his Party Table Kick Course technique, delivering a devastating series of kicks to multiple Franky Family members simultaneously, sending them flying across the room.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's refined fighting style and his ability to handle multiple opponents at once with his signature kick-based combat.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji using his new technique on Franky Family members

events.title: Roseo Colonnade Debut
events.description: Chopper demonstrates his Roseo Colonnade technique, a powerful attack that helps the crew overwhelm the Franky Family members during the raid.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's continued development as a fighter and his contributions to major battles despite being one of the younger crew members.

quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper using his new technique in the fight

events.title: Luffy Smashes Through Steel Armor
events.description: When a Franky Family member wearing steel armor confronts them, Luffy easily punches through the armor, shocking the other members and making them realize the true strength of the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Demonstrates the vast power difference between the Straw Hats and the Franky Family, establishing the crew's strength in the New World and intimidating their opponents.

events.title: Franky Family Defeated
events.description: The Straw Hats completely overwhelm and defeat all the Franky Family members present at Franky House. Despite the Franky Family's initial confidence, they are no match for the battle-hardened pirate crew.
events.significance: Establishes the Straw Hats' combat superiority and shows that they've grown significantly stronger since entering the Grand Line. The decisive victory cements their reputation in Water 7.

events.title: Crew Decides Not to Chase Franky
events.description: After defeating the Franky Family, the crew decides against pursuing Franky to recover their money. Instead, they choose to return to the ship, prioritizing being together and dealing with more pressing matters.
events.significance: Shows the crew's maturity in choosing their battles and recognizing that the money is less important than their unity and other concerns, particularly the Going Merry's condition.

events.title: Luffy Decides to Say Goodbye to Going Merry
events.description: At the end of the episode, Luffy makes the heart-wrenching decision that it's time to say goodbye to the Going Merry. This decision comes after learning from the shipwrights that the ship can no longer be repaired and is beyond saving.
events.significance: One of the most emotionally devastating moments in One Piece. This decision sets up the conflict between Luffy and Usopp that will tear the crew apart temporarily and leads to one of the arc's most emotional storylines.

quotes.text: It's time... we have to say goodbye to Merry.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's painful decision about the Going Merry

events.title: Franky Boards the Sea Train
events.description: After leaving Franky House with the stolen money, Franky is shown boarding the Sea Train, planning to use the Straw Hats' money for his own purposes.
events.significance: Establishes Franky's whereabouts and sets up future encounters. The Sea Train will become important to the arc's later events.

quotes.text: Give me back that money! It belongs to my crew!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp demanding the stolen money from the Franky Family

quotes.text: I'm going out shopping with the Straw Hats' money!
quotes.speaker: Franky

quotes.text: This is Usopp's blood! He must have gone to the Franky House alone!
quotes.speaker: Chopper

quotes.text: The money doesn't matter anymore. It's what you did to Usopp!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explaining why they're fighting the Franky Family

quotes.text: It's time... we have to say goodbye to Merry.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's painful decision about the Going Merry

themes.description: The episode powerfully demonstrates the Straw Hats' unwavering loyalty to each other. When they find Usopp beaten and bloody, the crew's rage and determination to avenge him shows that their bonds transcend material concerns like money.
themes.symbolism: Usopp's blood trail represents the physical and emotional pain that connects the crew, leading them to stand up for their nakama no matter the cost.

themes.description: Luffy's decision to say goodbye to the Going Merry represents one of the hardest lessons in life - knowing when to let go of something beloved. The episode explores the pain of accepting that some things cannot be saved, no matter how much they mean to us.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry symbolizes the crew's innocence and early adventures. Deciding to let her go represents growing up and accepting harsh realities.

themes.description: Usopp's solo confrontation with the Franky Family stems from his desire to prove his worth to the crew. His brutal defeat amplifies his existing insecurities about being the weakest member, setting up his later emotional breakdown.
themes.symbolism: Usopp standing alone against overwhelming odds represents his internal struggle with self-worth and his place in the crew.

themes.theme: Strength of Bonds Over Material Wealth
themes.description: The crew makes it clear that avenging Usopp matters more than recovering the stolen money. This reinforces the series' core message that relationships and loyalty are more valuable than treasure or wealth.
themes.symbolism: The abandoned pursuit of the money represents the crew's prioritization of emotional bonds over material gain.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's brave but futile attempt to recover the money alone demonstrates his desire to prove himself worthy of the crew. His brutal beating becomes a catalyst for both the crew's raid and his own emotional crisis about his place in the crew.
keyActions: Confronts Franky Family alone at their hideout
Attempts to fight Franky despite being outmatched
Gets brutally beaten by the Franky Family
quotes: Give me back that money! It belongs to my crew!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his growth as a captain by making two difficult decisions: avenging Usopp regardless of the money, and accepting that they must let go of the Going Merry. Both decisions show his maturity in prioritizing what truly matters.
keyActions: Follows Usopp's blood trail to Franky House
Declares the money doesn't matter, only what happened to Usopp
Leads the raid on Franky House
Decides they must say goodbye to the Going Merry
quotes: The money doesn't matter anymore. It's what you did to Usopp!
It's time... we have to say goodbye to Merry.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his combat growth with his new technique while also showing his loyalty to the crew by immediately joining the fight to avenge Usopp.
keyActions: Tracks Usopp to Franky House with the crew

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's participation in the raid and his new technique showcase his dedication to protecting his crewmates and his evolution as a fighter.
keyActions: Storms Franky House with the crew

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's medical knowledge helps him identify Usopp's blood trail, and his combat contributions show his growth as both a doctor and a fighter.
quotes: This is Usopp's blood! He must have gone to the Franky House alone!

characterSpotlights.development: Franky is established as a powerful and somewhat callous figure who easily defeats Usopp and takes the crew's money without remorse, setting up future conflicts.
keyActions: Delivers brutal kick to Usopp's chin
Leaves with the stolen 200 million berries
quotes: I'm going out shopping with the Straw Hats' money!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the fight sequences at Franky House with additional combat scenes and techniques not shown in the manga panels.
The anime added more detailed shots of Usopp's injuries and the blood trail leading to Franky House for dramatic effect.
Additional dialogue and reactions from the Franky Family members were included in the anime to extend the episode runtime.

trivia.fact: This episode has a TV rating of 10.0%, ranking 6th in viewership for the series at the time of its airing in Japan.
Episode 234 covers content from three manga chapters: Chapter 329 (pages 12-19), Chapter 330 (pages 2-19), and Chapter 331 (pages 2-3).
This episode marks the debut of four new techniques: Gomu Gomu no Cannon (Luffy), Karasuma Gari (Zoro), Party Table Kick Course (Sanji), and Roseo Colonnade (Chopper).
Kazuki Yao voiced Franky in this episode. He would continue to voice the character for nearly 20 years until stepping down in late 2024, when Subaru Kimura took over the role.

sources.title: Franky Voice - One Piece - Behind The Voice Actors

trivia.fact: The Funimation English dub of this episode aired on Toonami on November 30, 2013, over 8 years after the original Japanese broadcast.
The Japanese title 'Nakama Kyūshutsu! Nagarikomi Furankī Hausu' literally translates to 'Crewmate Rescue! Charging In to Franky House', emphasizing the nakama theme central to this episode.
This episode is part of the Water 7 Arc, which is widely considered one of the best arcs in One Piece for its emotional depth and character development.
